title: What to do if your vehicle is submerged in water
description: The best way to survive a vehicle submersion is to escape through the windows before the car is fully submerged, experts agree.

title: Mercedes, GM, Stellantis scramble; Port jobs are at risk after Baltimore disaster
description: Baltimore's port isn't one of the nation's largest, and some goods can be rerouted. But some auto companies are having to scramble, and the bridge disaster could spell trouble for local jobs.

title: N.Y. judge issues a limited gag order on Trump ahead of hush money trial
description: The new gag order on former President Donald Trump specifically bars him from making public statements about witnesses, prosecutors or jurors in his first criminal trial.

title: Conditions in Gaza and Tense Israel-US Relations
description:
We hear from a U.N. spokesperson about the conditions for civilians he saw in Gaza. We also speak to an Israeli government minister about the level of humanitarian aid entering Gaza and about why a delegation to the U.S. was cancelled over a vote at the U.N.

For more coverage of all sides of this conflict, go to npr.org/mideastupdates

title: Robert Kennedy Jr. taps a wealthy California attorney as his running mate
description: Kennedy, who's known for anti-vaccine advocacy and as a promoter of conspiracy theories, picked Nicole Shanahan, a political novice, as his running mate for his independent presidential campaign.

title: How climate-driven migration could change the face of the U.S.
description: ProPublica reporter Abrahm Lustgarten says millions of Americans are likely to move in the coming decades to escape wildfires, rising seas, oppressive heat and drought. His new book is On the Move.

title: NBC's newest contributor is receiving backlash — even from the network's own talent
description: Following the 2020 election, McDaniel, a Trump ally, said that she believed that the position was stolen from the former president by President Biden — which has been proven to be false.

title: Justices seem skeptical of challenge to restrict access to abortion pill
description: At issue in the case is more than abortion rights. It's the entire structure of the FDA's regulatory power to approve drugs and continually evaluate their safety.

title: Trump's social media company surges in trading debut in a big boost to Trump's wealth
description: Trump Media and Technology Group surged in its trading debut, substantially boosting the former president's wealth — at least on paper.

title: Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapses; SCOTUS takes on abortion pill case
description: A vital Baltimore bridge collapsed overnight after a ship crashed into it. How the Supreme Court's ruling in the abortion pill case could affect other drugs.

title: For patients with disabilities, this doctor prioritizes independence — and fun
description: Sometimes health care means being able to go out and watch a wrestling match, according to Dr. Clarissa Kripke. She's pioneering a new kind of care for people with disabilities.

title: Meta is limiting how much political content users see. Here's how to opt out of that
description: Meta is now limiting the amount of political content it recommends to Instagram and Threads users. Here's why it made the change — and how to opt out of it.

title: With war in Gaza, Israel faces new pressure to draft the ultra-Orthodox into service
description: Religious scholars have broad exemption from military service. But critics say that's no longer sustainable, given their fast-growing population and the war in Gaza.

title: An egg exploded in her face. The ride to the hospital made her feel safe
description: After Kathryn Fumie burned her face in a kitchen accident, the EMT on the ride to the hospital helped her feel like everything was going to be OK.

title: Trump has embraced Jan. 6. The extremist message may alienate — or resonate
description: He praises defendants who are charged with rioting that day. His campaign's launch site has connections to extremist violence. Experts worry he's tapping into anger that motivated domestic terrorism.

title: A Supreme Court abortion pill case with potential consequences for every other drug
description: At issue is the FDA's regulatory power to approve drugs and continually evaluate their safety — a system that until now has been widely viewed as the gold standard for both safety and innovation

title: She reads the newspaper on TikTok — and her videos are going viral
description: Newspapers are losing the battle against smartphones as the place to learn the news, but one woman has found a way to bridge the divide and bring the print to the people.

title: The Francis Scott Key bridge in Baltimore collapses after a ship crashed into it
description: A part of a Baltimore bridge serving as a vital highway artery and an East Coast shipping hub collapsed early Tuesday morning after a container ship crashed into it, sending people into the water.

title: What is the new etiquette for tipping?
description: Tipping requests are on the rise. Businesses that never seemed to ask for a tip, like fast food joints, are now asking for one. Here's how to deal with unexpected requests and more.

title: The IRS has 940,000 unclaimed tax refunds from 2020 that are about to expire
description: The average median refund is $932 for 2020. Texas (93,400), California (88,200), Florida (53,200) and New York (51,400) have the largest amount of people potentially eligible for these refunds.

title: Powerball jackpot climbs to $865 million as long winless drought continues
description: The Powerball jackpot increased to an estimated $865 million after no one won Monday night's drawing, continuing a winless streak that dates to New Year's Day.

title: Homes linked to Sean "Diddy" Combs raided by law enforcement
description: Homeland Security officials said the raids are part of an ongoing investigation with law enforcement in New York, Miami and Los Angeles.
